abstract: Bank of America said Wednesday that it has agreed to invest $2 billion in troubled lender Countrywide Financial, buying preferred shares that carry an interest rate of 7.25 percent and can be converted into common stock at $18 each.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America said Wednesday that it has agreed to invest $2 billion in troubled lender Countrywide Financial, buying preferred shares that carry an interest rate of 7.25 percent and can be converted into common stock at $18 each.

headline.main: BofA Buys $2 Billion Stake in Countrywide
